alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (West Virginia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 14 at 5:53PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of east central Lincoln and northwestern Boone Counties through 630 PM EDT... At 553 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm over Madison, moving north at 25 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 30 mph and pea size hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. Locations impacted include... Madison, Julian, Danville, Foster, Turtle Creek, Woodville and Alkol. This includes Route 119 between mile markers 47 and 63. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.25 IN MAX WIND GUST...30 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building. Torrential rainfall is also occurring with this storm and may lead to localized flooding. Do not drive your vehicle through flooded roadways.
